source.4e8ad363: ** Use the .info() method to find out how many entries there are.**
source.2f17ea9f: ** Read Salaries.csv as a dataframe called sal.**
source.25daa47d: ** What is the job title of  JOSEPH DRISCOLL ? Note: Use all caps, otherwise you may get an answer that doesn't match up (there is also a lowercase Joseph Driscoll). **
source.4fe03f43: ** Check the head of the DataFrame. **
source.544c7108: ** What are the top 5 most common jobs? **
source.ccb9b337: ** What is the name of highest paid person (including benefits)?**
source.8a78a0aa: ** How much does JOSEPH DRISCOLL make (including benefits)? **
source.faa9c54a: ** What was the average (mean) BasePay of all employees per year? (2011-2014) ? **
source.8ac5227a: ** What is the highest amount of OvertimePay in the dataset ? **
source.7be3b48f: ** How many Job Titles were represented by only one person in 2013? (e.g. Job Titles with only one occurence in 2013?) **
source.b6a71bbb: ** Bonus: Is there a correlation between length of the Job Title string and Salary? **
source.8108ae6a:
# SF Salaries Exercise 

Welcome to a quick exercise for you to practice your pandas skills! We will be using the [SF Salaries Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/kaggle/sf-salaries) from Kaggle! Just follow along and complete the tasks outlined in bold below. The tasks will get harder and harder as you go along.
source.884cda90: ** What is the name of lowest paid person (including benefits)? Do you notice something strange about how much he or she is paid?**
